Craft coffee, rooted in origin

Single-origin beans from Ethiopia, Colombia, and Guatemala. Roasted in Portland. Served in our cafés or delivered to your door.

Shop CoffeeBook a Workshop

Sourced from three origins

We partner directly with small farms for traceability, quality, and fair pay.

Ethiopia

Yirgacheffe

Floral, citrus, blueberry

We work with a women-owned cooperative in Yirgacheffe for bright, complex lots.

Colombia

Huila

Caramel, red apple, cocoa

Smallholder farmers in Huila deliver consistently sweet, balanced profiles.

Guatemala

Huehuetenango

Chocolate, stone fruit, nutty

High-altitude Huehuetenango brings depth and structure to our blends.

Our sourcing story →

Fresh from the roastery

Whole bean, subscriptions, and brewing gear.

View all
Ethiopia

Ethiopia Yirgacheffe

Bright and floral with notes of blueberry, jasmine, and citrus. Washed process from our partner cooperative in Yirgacheffe.

$22.00View
Colombia

Colombia Huila

Sweet and balanced with caramel, red apple, and cocoa. Direct trade from smallholder farmers in Huila.

$20.00View
Guatemala

Guatemala Huehuetenango

Deep and structured with dark chocolate, stone fruit, and a nutty finish. High-altitude Huehuetenango.

$21.00View

Learn to brew like a pro

Join our in-person workshops at the Pearl District café. Pour-over basics, espresso at home, and sensory cupping.

What coffee lovers say

— James T., Portland, OR

“I’ve been to both cafés and the pour-over workshop. These folks know their craft and care about the farmers.”

— Maya L., Portland, OR
